intro: Lapaea, commonly known as field bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Lapaea is native to Europe and Asia but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. It is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth and ability to spread rapidly.
